news_header: Sotkamo Silver reports increased profits due to rising silver prices and production, with positive expectations for the year.
news_text: Sotkamo Silver has seen a profit increase as silver prices rise and production ramps up. The company, operating Finland's only silver mine, has turned its fortunes around after a challenging start to the year. From July to September, operating profit reached SEK 30 million. The mine, located in an underground tunnel, has improved its output, with estimates of producing 1.2 to 1.4 million ounces of silver this year. Currently, silver prices are at $33.7, the highest since 2020. CEO Mikko Jalasto expresses optimism about sustained demand and plans to continue production development.
